title: How to Store Mozzarella

steps.headline: Keep fresh mozzarella in its container of liquid if it has one.
steps.description: If you bought your fresh mozzarella from the store, it may have come in an airtight container with liquid at the bottom. Keep your mozzarella in this container to keep it moist. The liquid is actually whey, a byproduct of when mozzarella is made. You can replace it with water if it gets low.

steps.headline: Transfer your mozzarella to a bowl of cold water if it was vacuum packed.
steps.description: Take your mozzarella out of the vacuum package and place it in a large bowl filled with cold water. Change out the water each day you keep your cheese in the fridge. This will mimic the whey that the mozzarella would be sitting in and stop the cheese from drying out.Fresh mozzarella usually looks like a round ball of cheese rather than a block or a loaf.

steps.headline: Store mozzarella in the fridge for 2 to 3 days.
steps.description: Place your fresh mozzarella on the middle shelf of your fridge. Try to eat your mozzarella as soon as you can for the best taste and freshness.Tip: If you haven’t opened up your mozzarella yet, you can keep it in the fridge for up to 3 weeks. Never freeze fresh mozzarella. The texture and flavor won’t be the same. Keep your fridge between 34 and 40 °F (1 and 4 °C).

steps.headline: Take your mozzarella out of the fridge 1 hour before you serve it.
steps.description: Mozzarella tastes the best when it is room temperature. Pull your cheese out of the fridge about 1 hour to warm it up before you use it for the best flavor.You can use fresh mozzarella on salads, pizzas, and pasta.

steps.headline: Wrap your loaf mozzarella in plastic wrap after you open it.
steps.description: Loaf mozzarella usually comes vacuum packed. After you open up your cheese, wrap it back up with plastic wrap to make sure it doesn’t come into contact with air and keep it from getting hard. Loaf mozzarella usually looks like rectangular bricks of cheese.

steps.headline: Seal shredded mozzarella in its packaging.
steps.description: Shredded mozzarella often comes in a resealable bag or tub. As soon as you open your mozzarella, seal the rest up in the packaging it came in.If your shredded mozzarella didn't come in resealable packaging, put it in an airtight bag or container.

steps.headline: Keep your mozzarella in the crisper drawer of your fridge.
steps.description: The crisper drawer of your fridge has a different level of humidity than the rest of your fridge. Use this drawer to keep your cheese from drying out as you store it.The crisper drawers are usually at the bottom of your fridge. You may be using them to store vegetables or leafy greens.

steps.headline: Eat loaf and shredded mozzarella within 21 days.
steps.description: Loaf and shredded mozzarella can keep for much longer than fresh mozzarella. Eat them within 21 to 28 days after you first open them up.Tip: The sooner you eat your cheese, the better it will taste.

steps.headline: Store unopened packages of mozzarella in the freezer for 3 months.
steps.description: If you haven’t punctured the vacuum seal of your cheese, store it in the freezer before you eat it. Thaw it in the fridge for 1 day before you use it. Don’t store opened mozzarella in the freezer. This could cause the cheese to get moist and might change the taste or texture.
